newsitem.title: USA: Informix plunges on Q1 loss forecast.
newsitem.headline: Informix plunges on Q1 loss forecast.

text.p: Informix Corp shares fell as much as 42 percent Tuesday after the database software company said it expects to report a "substantial" first-quarter loss on revenue that will be far below what Wall Street was expecting.
Shares of Informix, based in Menlo Park, Calif., plunged 4-1/2 to 10-5/8 in late morning trading. Earlier, the shares traded as low as 8-3/4, a three-year low.
Informix blamed the loss on drastically weaker sales in all geographic regions and product lines. Analysts said Informix also is being squeezed by competitors.
"They're getting crushed by Oracle Corp on the higher end and Microsoft Cor on the low end," said David Rothschild, managing director of brokerage Piper Jaffray.

Informix writes computer programs, called databases, that store and retrieve huge amounts of information in corporate computer networks. In December, the company released a new version of its flagship product, Informix Universal Server, that can store not only text and numbers, like traditional databases, but also sound and pictures.
"Universal Server is cool technology, but people don't go out to buy technology," Rothschild said.
Slow adoption of Informix Universal Server could hamper Informix's revenues for the rest of the year, analysts said.
Informix also faces heat from Oracle when the bigger rival introduces in June an updated version of its flagship database product, Oracle8.

Informix told investors in a conference call Tuesday morning that the "over-emphasis" of marketing effort on its new generation of products kept the company from landing big customer accounts in the quarter.
Informix expects first-quarter revenue of $130-$145 million, down from $204 million in the same quarter a year ago.
The loss forecast for the quatter prompted at least two Wall Street analysts to lower their ratings on the stock to "neutral" or "hold."
